sgraph

Class AbstractNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • sgraph.AbstractNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    INode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GroupNode, LeafNode, TransformNode

    public abstract class AbstractNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements INode
    This abstract class implements the INode interface. It provides default methods for many of the methods, especially the ones that could throw an exception Child classes that do not want these exceptions throws should override these methods
    Author:
    Amit Shesh

        protected java.lang.String name
        The name given to this node

      • parent

        protected INode parent
        The parent of this node. Each node except the root has a parent. The root's parent is null

        protected IScenegraph scenegraph
        A reference to the IScenegraph object that this is part of

      • getNode

        public INode getNode(java.lang.String name)
        By default, this method checks only itself. Nodes that have children should override this method and navigate to children to find the one with the correct name
        Specified by:
        getNode in interface INode
        Parameters:
        name - name of node to be searched
        Returns:
        the node whose name this is, null otherwise

      • setScenegraph

        public void setScenegraph(IScenegraph graph)
        Sets the scene graph object whose part this node is and then adds itself to the scenegraph (in case the scene graph ever needs to directly access this node)
        Specified by:
        setScenegraph in interface INode
        Parameters:
        graph - a reference to the scenegraph object of which this tree is a part
